article.description:
Michael Lindeman scored a career-high 19
points and No. 16 Creighton routed Illinois State 76-57 Saturday
night.
article.headline: Lindeman scores career-high 19 in victory
article.linkText: Lindeman has career night as Creighton routs Illinois St.
article.story:
NORMAL, Ill. (AP) -- Kyle Korver shrugged off a one-game shooting
slump and Creighton turned up the defense Saturday night as the
16th-ranked Bluejays routed Illinois State 76-57.

	   With Illinois State trying to use a gimmick defense to slow
Korver, Creighton looked to Deren Brody, Joe Dabbert and Mike
Grimes, who combined to shoot 10-for-13 inside.

	   "They made a commitment to stop Kyle with that box-and-one,''
Creighton coach Dana Altman said. "We went inside and Joe, Deren
and Brody were able to complete plays for us.''

	   Creighton (13-1, 4-0 Missouri Valley Conference) shot 60 percent
(30-for-50) for the game.

	   Korver, who was 4-for-14 from the field and 1-for-8 on 3-pointers
in a win over Bradley on Wednesday, was 4-for-5 from 3-point range
and had 17 points against Illinois State (1-11, 0-4).

	   "What can you say about him? Not many guys can shoot the ball
six times and score 17 points,'' said Creighton's Michael Lindeman,
who finished with a career-high 19 points. "Kyle doesn't have to
score, though, to help this team. Other teams key on him, and he
just finds the open guy.''

	   Korver, who hit all but one of his 3s off a pick, also had four
rebounds, three assists, a block and a steal.

	   Vince Greene had 17 points and seven assists for Illinois State.

	   Creighton opened the second half with an 11-3 run to take a
13-point lead with about 15 minutes left. Illinois State rallied to
get within 48-40, before Creighton re-established control, churning
out runs of 9-3 and 14-5 in the final 10 minutes.

	   "Their inside guys are bigger and stronger than us, and they're
older,'' said Illinois State coach Tom Richardson, whose team
played two seniors. "I thought we did a pretty good job on Korver,
but then Lindeman steps up and has a game like he did. That's why
they're so good.''

	   Korver had 11 points in the first half and the first of his
three 3-pointers was the 300th of his career.

	   Lindeman hit a 3-pointer from the wing with five seconds left in
the first half and it looked like Creighton would enjoy a 10-point
halftime lead.

	   But Greene found Gregg Alexander open at halfcourt. Alexander
dribbled twice and launched a 35-foot shot that banked off the
glass at the buzzer and cut the lead to seven.

	   Creighton held the Redbirds to 31 percent shooting in the second
half and forced a total of 18 turnovers.
